trans-unit.source: Provides default functionality for all SOAP attributes.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute> is nonfunctional, and can be used only as the base class for SOAP attributes.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the type must be nested during SOAP serialization.
`true` if the target object must be nested during SOAP serialization; otherwise, `false`.
The XML namespace to which the target of the current SOAP attribute is serialized.

You can get or set the value of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute.ProtXmlNamespace> field through the public <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute.XmlNamespace%2A> property.
A reflection object used by attribute classes derived from the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute"></xref> class to set XML serialization information.
You do not need to use the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute.ReflectInfo> field directly.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the target of the current attribute will be serialized as an XML attribute instead of an XML field.

For example, if a field `FieldA` of an object `ObjectB` is qualified with the `SoapFieldAttribute(UseAttribute=true)` attribute, `FieldA` will be serialized as `<ObjectB><FieldA>5</FieldA></ObjectB>`.
If the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute.UseAttribute%2A> property is set to `false`, `FieldA` will be serialized as `<ObjectB FieldA="5"></ObjectB>`.
`true` if the target object of the current attribute must be serialized as an XML attribute; `false` if the target object must be serialized as a subelement.
Gets or sets the XML namespace name.
If the current property returns `null`, then the namespace is not qualified.
The XML namespace name under which the target of the current attribute is serialized.
